description.desc1: Projects textures outwards from the location of the Camera
description.desc2: This is a shader and can be applied to any model node.

Shader.descript:
choose between the different projection types. 
	<li>'multiblend' is the sophisticated mode 
		 that allows up to 6 projections 
		 and complex blending 
	<li>'addition' adds up all projected textures 
	<li>'single' is for a single texure

stage mode.descript:
display mode of the model on which this shader is applied onto. 
	<li>'Textured' shows the projected texture(s) 
	<li>'Colored' shows the projections in colors 
	<li>'Overlap' shows the amount of overlap 
	<li>'Map' shows the differentiation 
	<li>'BeamX' shows projection X

bg color.descript: color if no projected texture reaches the surface

projection.descript:
Onto which face of the model this texture is projected: 
	<li>'back' 
	<li>'both sides' 
	<li>'front'

spread.descript: spread factor will increase the differentiation between overlapping projections (1 = full spread)

angle.descript:
angle differentiation: 
	<li>'viewray' will differentiate based on the 
		 angle between the surface normal and 
		 the viewray, 
	<li>'direction' will differentiate based on 
		 the angle between the surface normal 
		 and the camera direction.

distance.descript: use distance as an additional differentiator. It will show its influence when the spread is increased. (0 = no influence)

limit.descript: angle limit, how much of the visible surface area is considered (0 = no limit)

falloff.descript: size of falloff gradient at the angle limit

bevel.descript: bevel size. it creates a gradient falloff defined by the frustum cone of the camera

use detail settings.descript: opens the individual settings for each camera (Beamer A - F)

interpolation correction.descript: interpolation correction. if strange artefacts start to appear, raise the value until the artefacts disappear. the artefacts are a result of interpolation errors between the vertex and fragment shader and occur close to the local x-y plane of the camera. increasing the subdivisions of the model can help, too

collada.descript: select if the node that applies this shader is using a collada file. This corrects a default rotation by the collada importer.

Feedback.feedback1: Documentations take a lot of time and effort. Unfortunately both are scarce ressources.
Feedback.feedback2: If you would like to have more info about this node please drop a note. It helps to set priorities according to the user needs...
